frame.name: Records
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Record</fen> that contains a permanent account of <fen>Data</fen>. This <fen>Record</fen> may be maintained by a <fen>Recorder</fen> for a certain <fen>Entity</fen>. <ex></ex> <ex><fex name="Entity">The bank's</fex> <t><fex name="Record">books</fex></t> were not accurate.</ex>
<ex>He made notes of the subject's responses in the <t><fex name="Record">journal</fex></t> by the desk.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Recorder">She</fex> <m>kept</m> a <fex name="Record"><t>record</t></fex> <fex name="Data">of how many times Steven had asked her for money</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Record
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fex name="Record">Record</fex> is the entity in which events or accounts are permanently recorded. <ex>She kept a <t><fex name="Record">record</fex></t> of how many times he asked to borrow money.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Data
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Data</fen> is the information which is recorded in the <fen>Record</fen>. It is often expressed as a prepositional phrase. <ex>Andy kept a <t>log</t> <fex name="Data">of the girls he had dated</fex>.</ex> <ex>His assistant maintained the <t>records</t> <fex name="Data">of customer payments</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Recorder
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Recorder</fen> is the person who records the <fen>Data</fen> in the <fen>Record</fen>. <ex><fex name="Recorder">Shirley's</fex> <t>log</t> of her favorite eateries grew every day.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Entity
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Entity</fen> is the person or institution for which the <fen>Record</fen> is maintained. <ex>She keeps the <t>books</t> <fex name="Entity">for the advertising firm</fex>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Entity">The bank's</fex> <t>records</t> were not ready for the unexpected audit.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Type
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Type</fen> refers to the kind of <fen>Record</fen> being kept. <ex>Molly was in charge of the <fex name="Type">finacial</fex> <t>records</t> at the small law firm.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Descriptor
FE.definition:
<def-root>A characteristic of the <fen>Record</fen>.
<ex>Moria's bank kept <fex name="Descriptor">detailed</fex> <t>books</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Medium
FE.definition: <def-root>The Medium is the language in which a Record is composed, or the physical medium (radio, ink) in which it is distributed. </def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition: <def-root>The region where the <fen>Record</fen> is sold, circulated, or otherwise popular</def-root>

FE.name: Time_of_creation
FE.definition: <def-root>The Time at which the <fen>Record</fen> was created. </def-root>

FE.name: Use
FE.definition: <def-root>The use for which the <fen>Record</fen> was produced; its purpose. </def-root>

lexUnit.name: book.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the records of the accounts of a business (usually plural); any other binded pages which contain recorded data

lexUnit.name: log.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a book in which data is recorded

lexUnit.name: record.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: an entity in which events or data are recorded

lexUnit.name: journal.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a book in which data is kept

lexUnit.name: recording.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: information that is stored on a medium
